oai:datarep.app.ist.ac.at:37;2017-03-30T14:27:55Z;	Inference of mating patterns among wild snapdragons in a natural hybrid zone in 2012.;Field, David;Ellis, Thomas;576 Genetics and evolution;577 Ecology;Genotypic, phenotypic and demographic data for 2128 wild snapdragons and 1127 open-pollinated progeny from a natural hybrid zone, collected as part of Tom Ellis' PhD thesis (submitted) February 2016).

Tissue samples were sent to LGC Genomics in Berlin for DNA extraction, and genotyping at 70 SNP markers by KASPR genotyping. 29 of these SNPs failed to amplify reliably, and have been removed from this dataset.

name: 6cac1636-dc33-5b7d-a4ba-e28edb7ab8fb
notes:
Genotypic, phenotypic and demographic data for 2128 wild snapdragons and 1127 open-pollinated progeny from a natural hybrid zone, collected as part of Tom Ellis' PhD thesis (submitted) February 2016).

Tissue samples were sent to LGC Genomics in Berlin for DNA extraction, and genotyping at 70 SNP markers by KASPR genotyping. 29 of these SNPs failed to amplify reliably, and have been removed from this dataset.

Other data were retreived from an online database of this population at www.antspec.org.
title: Inference of mating patterns among wild snapdragons in a natural hybrid zone in 2012.
